citation.article-title: Classification of eight new species of ammonia-oxidizing bacteria: Nitrosomonas communis sp. nov., Nitrosomonas ureae sp. nov., Nitrosomonas aestuarii sp. nov., Nitrosomonas marina sp. nov., Nitrosomonas nitrosa sp. nov., Nitrosomonas eutropha sp. nov., Nitrosomonas oligotropha sp. nov. and Nitrosomonas halophila sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nitrosomonas eutropha sp. nov.
Nitrosomonas eutropha (eu.troph'a. Gr. pref. eu-, good ; Gr. n. trophos, one who feeds; ML fem. n. eutropha, good nutrition)
The description is based on 10 isolates.
Cells tend to be pleomorphic, rod to pear-shaped (sometimes coccoid).
Cells 1.0-1.3 by 1.6-2.3 μm in size, occasionally in short chains.
No salt requirement, high tolerance of increasing ammonia concentrations.
The G+C content of the DNA is 47.9-48.5 mol % (Tm).
Habitat: common in municipal and industrial, sewage disposal systems; seems to be distributed generally in strongly eutrophic environments.
Type strain : C-91 (= Nm 57) - culture collectionof the Institut fur Allgemeine Botanik der Universitiit Hamburg, Mikrobiologische Abteilung, FRG.
